{
    "number": 245630,
    "data": "1,6,15,35,36,77,90,143,210,216,221,225,323,437,462,525,540,667,858,899,1147,1155,1225,1260,1296,1326,1350,1517,1763,1938,2021,2145,2491,2622,2695,2772,3127,3150,3240,3315,3375,3599,4002,4087,4757,4845,5005,5148,5183",
    "name": "Products of members of A006094.",
    "comment": [
        "Multiplicative monoid generated by products of two successive primes.",
        "All natural numbers of the form product(i=1..infinity, Prime(i)*Prime(i+1))^m_i) for integers m_i >= 0 (all but finitely many m_i = 0).",
        "The smallest subset A of the natural numbers such that",
        "1) 1 is in A",
        "2) if n is in A then so is n * Prime(i) * Prime(i+1) for all i.",
        "Subset of A028260."
    ],
    "link": [
        "Robert Israel, <a href=\"/A245630/b245630.txt\">Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..6742</a>",
        "Paul Erd\u0151s, <a href=\"http://www.jstor.org/stable/2306529\">Solution to Advanced Problem 4413</a>, American Mathematical Monthly, 59 (1952) 259-261."
    ],
    "formula": [
        "As n -> infinity, a(n)/n^2 -> product(i=1..infinity, (1 - 1/sqrt(prime(i)*prime(i+1)))^2/(1-1/prime(i))^2) (see Erd\u0151s reference)."
    ],
    "example": [
        "1 is in the sequence.",
        "6 = 2*3 is in the sequence.",
        "36 = (2*3)^2 is in the sequence.",
        "90 = (2*3) * (3*5) is in the sequence."
    ],
    "maple": [
        "N:= 10^6: # to get all terms <= N",
        "PP:= [seq(ithprime(i)*ithprime(i+1),i=1.. numtheory[pi](floor(sqrt(N)))-1)]:",
        "ext:= (x,p) -> seq(x*p^i,i=0..floor(log[p](N/x))):",
        "S:= {1}:",
        "for i from 1 to nops(PP) do S:= map(ext,S,PP[i]) od:",
        "S;"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A006094, A028260, A245636."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn",
    "offset": "1,2",
    "author": "_Robert Israel_, Jul 27 2014",
    "references": 3,
    "revision": 21,
    "time": "2016-01-12T05:56:25-05:00",
    "created": "2014-07-30T00:37:46-04:00"
}
